Articles.Content: I've tried to start a campaign but after selecting difficulty, naming and setting up a flag i've clicked the Start Campaign button an nothing happend. It would be awesome if you could provide me with a new save and where to put it.
I'll click start campaign and then it gets stuck on "Pumping Sim Once" and then won't load.  I haven't found a workaround yet.

3 hours ago, SneakyDoge said:

I'll click start campaign and then it gets stuck on "Pumping Sim Once" and then won't load.  I haven't found a workaround yet.

same, lets hope they can fix this in the next patch
I'm no KSP dev, but maybe you could send your "player.log" so we may find an explanation (it is in the folder "%USERPROFILE%\AppData\LocalLow\Intercept Games\Kerbal Space Program 2\")

This is my log folder, hopefully they can get there broken game working soon since they decided to release it to early.

One thing is sure, something wrong happens around you graphic card.

What graphic card do you have precisely? Are your drivers up to date?

My log file is Actually more than 16000 lines but most of them say the same

NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at KSP.Rendering.GraphicsManager.LateUpdate () [0x00000] in <8c5bdf369a8c45f68951f69eb825ef73>:0

NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at KSP.Game.PersistentProfileManager.get_AutoSaveEnabled () [0x00005] in <8c5bdf369a8c45f68951f69eb825ef73>:0
  at KSP.Game.SaveLoadManager.Update () [0x00000] in <8c5bdf369a8c45f68951f69eb825ef73>:0

Seeing the same issue on first computer tried running on. System is running Windows 11. Cleaned up space on my Windows 10 laptop (only had 16GB free, needed more space) and once installed on that, it loaded up and ran with no issues (other than some fins on launch pad for a second going super long than back to normal (have GeForce RTX 3050, i7, 32GB RAM on that computer)). I do have some other hardware OS combinations I will test out this weekend to see if I notice a pattern.
